3. "Akira" - A classic anime from Japan, "Akira" presents a dystopian future where motorcycle-riding biker gangs rule the streets.
4. "District 9" - Set in Johannesburg, South Africa, this film explores themes of apartheid and xenophobia as they apply to an alien race.
5. "Ex Machina" - This thought-provoking sci-fi follows a young programmer who is invited to administer the Turing test to an intelligent humanoid robot.
6. "Ghost in the Shell" - Based on the manga series, this film delves into themes of cybernetic technology and identity.
7. "Total Recall" - Starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, this film explores the idea of a future where people can purchase virtual vacations in artificial environments.
8. "Battlestar Galactica" - This series follows the last remnants of humanity as they flee across the universe in search of their mythical home planet, Earth.
9. "Strange Days" - Set in Los Angeles on the eve of the new millennium, this film explores the sale and use of a technology that allows users to record and experience other people's sensory perceptions.
10. "Snowpiercer" - In a future where Earth has become uninhabitable, the remaining survivors live aboard a perpetually moving train divided by class.
